questions.title:
Who conducted pioneering research on radio-
activity and earned two Nobel Prizes for
contributions to understanding atomic properties?
questions.bio:
Born in Poland, this scientist's profound invest-
igations into radioactivity reshaped the field of
atomic science. Her groundbreaking discoveries
not only laid the groundwork for modern under-
standings of radiation but also earned them the
distinction of being a double Nobel laureate.

questions.title:
Who made significant contributions to under-
standing molecular structures, including in
uncovering the DNA double helix?
questions.bio:
Emerging in mid-20th century England, this
brilliant mind's mastery of X-ray crystallography
unraveled the intricate structure of DNA's double
helix. Despite her pivotal contributions, her name
was often obscured, yet her legacyendures in the
realm of genetics and molecular biology.

questions.title:
Which mathematician's calculations were pivotal
in launching the first American astronauts into
space?
questions.bio:
Her calculations were behind the success of the
first American spaceflights. Her work ensured
the trajectories of astronauts were accurate
and safe, marking a significant milestone in space
exploration. Her legacy is a testament to the
power of math and determination in the face of
challenges.

questions.title:
Who  is  often  regarded  as the  world's  first
computer  programmer (before the first
computers emerged)?
questions.bio:
In 19 century England, she envisioned a machine
that could process not only numbers but also
instructions, laying the foundation for modern
computer programming. Her work opened a
realm of possibilities, influencing innovators
of the digital age.

questions.title:
Who was a movie-star and the co-inventor of a
frequency-hopping system that laid the ground-
work for modern wireless technologies?
questions.bio:
Born in 1914 in Austria, she helped develop a
system to prevent radio-guided torpedoes from
being jammed by enemies during World War II.
This invention, though initially overlooked, was
a precursor to today's technologies, including
Bluetooth and Wi-Fi.

questions.title:
Who  played  a  pivotal  role in confirming a fun-
damental theory in particle physics through a
groundbreaking experiment during the 20th century?
questions.bio:
Through a meticulous experiment, she provided
evidence for the theory of weak interaction in
particle physics, challenging conventional norms.
Her innovative methods and fearless pursuit of
truth reshaped our understanding of fundamental
forces, leaving a mark on the world of physics.

questions.title:
Which pioneering mathematician made significant
advancements in the field of partial differential
equations?
questions.bio:
Born in 1850 in Russia, this mathematician made
notable contributions to mathematical analysis.
She was the first woman in Europe to receive a
doctorate in mathematics,  breaking barriers for
women in the field. Her work continues to inspire
mathematicians today.

questions.title:
Which scholar excelled in mathematics, astronomy,
and philosophy, leaving an enduring legacy in the
ancient world?
questions.bio:
Born around 360 CE, this exceptional mind chal-
lenged societal norms, breaking through barriers
to excel in traditionally male-dominated fields. A
symbol of wisdom and resilience, her legacy
continues to inspire scholars and thinkers across
the ages.

questions.title:
Who became the first recipient of the Fields Medal
for achievements in the dynamics and geometry
of Riemann surfaces and their moduli spaces?
questions.bio:
Born in Tehran in 1977, this mathematician made
significant contributions to Riemann surfaces,
hyperbolic geometry, and topology. In 2014, she
became the first Iranian to win the Fields Medal.
Sadly, her influential journey ended in 2017.

questions.title:
Which scientist from Karnataka, India, was
instrumental in advancing the fields of microwave
engineering and antennae research?
questions.bio:
Originating from India, this engineer's pioneering
work in microwave engineering has had profound
implications in communications and radar techno-
logy. Her extensive research and innovative metho-
dologies have greatly influenced the design and
understanding of antennae systems.
